item.title: Dogs Fowling, 12th November
item.description:
I have seen on a regular basis owners of dogs allowing them to foul on Brookhill Road and not picking up the poo but when dog is finished the owner happily walks off to continue with their walk the dog walk. It's becoming a trend and it's shocking to see dog owners using Brookhill Road as a toilet. There needs to be signs that this is unacceptable on Brookhill Road.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brookhill Road, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lighting not working, 11th November
item.description:
After a month installing 6 new solar lighting posts, 3 of them are currently not working, 1 doesn recognize the movement to increase light intensity and the orher two have limited intensity. At night there's a section of the path poorly illuminated.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Erebus Drive, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bright light on east side of 1-33 Mandeville Cl, 11th November
item.description:
There is a very bright white LED light on the top floor of the east side of 1-33 16 Mandeville Cl, Vanbrugh Park, London SE3 7AQ. This light is constantly on all night, and shines directly at all houses on St Johns Park, and light comes into rooms. No light on the side of a building should be this bright and directional, please can this be covered, directed downwards, or changed to the same lights around it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Vanbrugh Park, Blackheath
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged motorbike abandoned, 11th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Balfour Grove, Brunswick Park, London

item.title: Fridge on pavement outside Indian takeaway, 11th November
item.description:
Severe safety risk of toppling. 6ft high single door fridge left on pavement approximately outside Ruchita Tandoori, 31 Avery Hill Road.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Avery Hill Road, Avery Hill
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very bight security spotlight directed at neighbours, 11th November
item.description:
There is a security spotlight with a deficient motion sensor which turns on and off all night long every day, the spotlight is very bright and pointed at neighbouring residential accommodation. We have attempted to contact the neighbours unsuccessfully.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): The Mothers Square, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tyres dumped and litter all along pavement, 11th November
item.description:
Two tyres have been dumped and left for several weeks on the pavement at the beginning of Allandale Avenue. There is also a huge amount of rubbish all along the pavement and road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4a, Allandale Avenue, Temple Fortune, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hartland Road NW6, 11th November
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hartland Road, London

item.title: Two fly tipped matresses, 11th November
item.description:
